DataElement.preferredName: Target Lesion RECIST Overall Response Status
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The overall response status for target lesions at a particular time, using Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors version 1.1 (RECISTv1.1).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Disease Response Domain Target Lesion Identification Overall Response
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A domain for disease response evaluations._The identification of a lesion that is present at baseline, is measurable and is the primary target of the therapeutic intervention._An assessment of the overall response of the disease to the therapy.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A domain for disease response evaluations.

Concepts.definition: A domain for disease response evaluations.

Property.preferredDefinition: The identification of a lesion that is present at baseline, is measurable and is the primary target of the therapeutic intervention.:An assessment of the overall response of the disease to the therapy.

Concepts.definition: The identification of a lesion that is present at baseline, is measurable and is the primary target of the therapeutic intervention.
An assessment of the overall response of the disease to the therapy.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for CDISC aligned NCI CRF standards task. mc

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Standard parameters to be used when documenting response of solid tumors to treatment; a set of published rules that define when cancer patients improve ("respond"), stay the same ("stable"), or worsen ("progression") during treatments. (from www.recist.com)_The identification of a lesion that is present at baseline, is measurable and is the primary target of the therapeutic intervention._Including everything._A condition or state at a particular time.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not all target lesions were assessed. Or not all non-target lesions were assessed.

Concepts.definition: Not all target lesions were assessed. Or not all non-target lesions were assessed.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated Long Name and Definition to match current NCIt. mc 4/27/2020

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.

Concepts.definition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Indicates a task, process or examination that has either not been initiated or not been completed.

Concepts.definition: Indicates a task, process or examination that has either not been initiated or not been completed.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A clinical, pathologic, and/or molecular finding indicating that the course of a disease is worsening in terms of extent or severity.

Concepts.definition: A clinical, pathologic, and/or molecular finding indicating that the course of a disease is worsening in terms of extent or severity.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes:
2023.5.17 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0002435. ak 
2023.3.15 Per LS at COG Protocol defined progressive disease (should have been added as a VM Alt Name for PV 3284666). ak

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A finding indicating that there is a decrease in the size and the extent of tissue involvement by a malignant tumor in a patient.

Concepts.definition: A finding indicating that there is a decrease in the size and the extent of tissue involvement by a malignant tumor in a patient.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cancer that is neither decreasing nor increasing in extent or severity.

Concepts.definition: A disease that is neither decreasing nor increasing in extent or severity.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.

Concepts.definition: Standard parameters to be used when documenting response of solid tumors to treatment; a set of published rules that define when cancer patients improve ("respond"), stay the same ("stable"), or worsen ("progression") during treatments. (from www.recist.com)

ValueDomain.origin: RECISTv1.1:Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors v1.1
ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/26/18 jk VD created for overall summary response of all target lesions (Table 1) in RECISTv1.1 guidelines.

ReferenceDocuments.name: iRECIST- 2017
ReferenceDocuments.description: iRECIST: guidelines for response criteria for use in trials testing immunotherapeutics

ReferenceDocuments.name: RECISTv1.1
ReferenceDocuments.description: New response evaluation criteria in solid tumors: Revised RECIST guideline (version 1.1) dated 2009

ReferenceDocuments.name: RECIST instruction
ReferenceDocuments.description: Mandatory on Follow up form to capture the "overall/all" Target lesions response. Note: Use CDISC aligned CDE 6941905 to collect individual target lesion response (log line). This CDE maps to RECISTv1.1 guideline summary Table 1, "Target Lesions" column.
